intro: Canthium celastroides, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain small, dark seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
